content: Per fortuna la cartela del profilo è intatta e la ho già salvata con tutti i miei dati. Tuttavia Thunderbird non compare nell'elenco di programi installati in start, sebbene esista la cartella: c:\Programma\Mozilla Thunderbird Con tutti le cartelle e file di Thunderbird (incluso del eseguibile thunderbird.exe). Penso deva fare un aggiornamento di thunderbird, ma nel programa non vedo il menu menu Aiuto ne la voce Informazioni su Thunderbird. Cosa meglio fare?

content:
Se hai cancellato la cartella del profilo, non è possibile ripristinare nulla purtroppo.

Se hai un backup si può ripartire da quello. Al limite puoi provare con un programma di recupero dati come Recuva, ma non ci conterei troppo.
creator: @next

content:
I give up!!! This is for a friends desktop that I have rebuilt and I've been playing around with this for two days now and it would seem that it works sometimes and then not. I seem to have it all sorted then when I go to my friends desktop, triumphantly saying I know how to recover all his lost calendar events, it doesn't work! Arggghhh!!!

I have now tried three ways: 1. Import from the profile folder that I have working on my laptop 2. Import from an ics file that I have just exported from the working profile on my laptop 3. Simply copy the sqlite file from my working profile to another profile

the results are: 1. sometimes works but usually not, appears to have worked but I have no events in the calendars 2. again sometimes works but sometimes get an error message and no events and calendar is suspended 3. again, sometimes works but sometimes get no events

So as you can see, I'm somewhat dumbfounded as to why its so inconsistent! And when I go to my friends desktop, I can't get any of the three to work! (well I couldn't yesterday, I will try again tomorrow!)
creator: jimc.lea

content: Uncheck the title item in Thunderbird Settings.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Update:

A workaround was to create a new subfolder (named LocalFolders/Updated) and move all the local folders to the new subfolder.

Then do the update.

Moving all the folders back to the root of the local folders is a pain because you can no longer select multiple folders. But it worked around the issue for me.

creator: valaoritis

content: AOL uses OAuth2 authentication, so you don't need an app password. Use your main account password instead. Make sure to select 'OAuth2' as 'Authentication method' in your AOL account server settings. This goes for both, the incoming, and outgoing server.
creator: christ1
